definitions: (of films) Classified as suitable for adults only
(in humans and some other mammals) Sex chromosome of which the number in female cells is twice that in male cells
Dry copying process in which powder adheres to areas remaining electrically charged after exposure of the surface to light from an image of the document to be copied
Fourteenth letter of the Greek alphabet
(in pl.) Electromagnetic radiation of short wavelength, able to pass through opaque bodies
Photograph made by X-rays, esp. showing the position of bones etc. by their greater absorption of the rays
Musical instrument of graduated wooden or metal bars struck with small wooden hammers
